Title: Power & Power to X – Technical Sales Consultant
Description:
Job Description
Schneider Electric, the leader in the digital transformation of energy management and automation, has topped the "World's Most Sustainable Companies for 2024" list by Time magazine and Statista, is looking for an ambitious and motivated Power and Power to X – Technical Sales Consultant to support the Power Generation (renewable and non-renewable) and Power to X Strategy Implementation.
The Process Automation Solutions Team brings industry domain expertise to drive sustainable growth in its focus new applications. The team seeks to strengthen its members with an experienced process expert in the role of Power and Power to X Technical Sales Consultant that will collaborate in growing the Process Automation Business globally in the Power and Power to X applications like:
Power to X: production of green hydrogen, green ammonia, e-methanol or any low carbon hydrogen derivative synthetic fuel, storage and supply.
Power Generation: hydro, geothermal, waste to energy, biomass, biogas, TMC (turbo machinery control), and advance applications in non-renewable power plants (e.g. combined cycle, hybrid coal-biomass, etc.)
This is an exciting role for a motivated and a knowledgeable technical leader who want to support the delivery of growth plan in a fast-growing market and in a global environment. The successful candidate is well rounded technical expert, curious, self-driven and highly motivated. Most importantly, develops deep application and process domain expertise in Power plants and Power to X (hydrogen, Ammonia, Methanol), Electrolysis, and the processes adopted by the different licensors and OEMs.
The individual will be the focal point for Process Automation with regards to technical aspects process and architecture for the above-mentioned applications.
 Roles and Responsibilities:
 Starting from consultative customer meetings, engineering documents and Process Flow Diagrams (PFD) build optimal automation solution leveraging on deep understanding of OEM and/or End User Application process.
Support Proposals to build winnable automation solutions to support global pursuits in Process Automation
Align with Power System, AEVEA and SE Segments Solution Architects to build integrated architectures integrating Power, Process and Software tools.
Support, with application knowledge, the delivery organisation to develop consistency, repeatability, and predictability on automation architecture to optimise engineering cost and accelerate project execution.
Support, with application knowledge, sales and pre-sales to drive prescription activities and define points of influence with customers at a technical level, including communication protocols, safety, cybersecurity, etc.
Support must win pursuits by working with & supporting local country accounts on technical, commercial, and tendering activities.
Focal point to animate, educate, and support PA regional TSC on Power and Power to X solutions and reference architectures.
Present demos during workshops and selected customer events
Support the preparation of Proof-of-Concept solutions as a mean to position PA offer in targeted pursuits.
Identify technical trends and feedback to R&D and PA Offer Portfolio teams.
Support PA Innovation Lab to develop new offers and solutions in the Power to X ecosystem.
Travel globally as necessary to support the development of Process Automation Business in the Power to X segment.
 KPI’s:
 Hit rate on winning opportunities
Support for pertinent value propositions integrating Power, Process and Software
Application deep domain knowledge and support for Process Automation Ops. 
Incremental growth of the Process Automation pipeline in the Power Generation and Power to X markets
Partnerships initiatives with key industry stakeholders
Increase in PA approved Vendor List participation with the players in the Power and Power to X markets
Requirements
 Bachelor’s degree in engineering or another STEM university studies
2-5 years in similar position (i.e. technical consultant, system architect) with at least 8 years’ experience in automation technical roles
Very Curious and passionate individual keen to learn. Role model for Mastery and Curiosity
Know-how about Schneider Electric Automation Portfolio
Know-how about EcoStruxure Power & Process solutions and value proposition
Know-how of Functional Safety standards and applications
Previous experience with AVEVA portfolio and Simulation tools is an advantage
Demonstrate the capability to develop process domain expertise in Power & Power to X process applications such as: electrolysis, ammonia synthesis, eFuel synthesis and industrial gases.
Team player passionate and dynamic with the energy and ability to obtain alignment and work effectively across a complex global matrix organisation.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, presenting effectively and speaking publicly to senior executives.
Solution design and system architecture methodology, starting from customer needs identification.
Very good English level (written and spoken) and another European language is an advantage.
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Ability to travel globally to site locations and customer meetings as needed.
 Let us learn about you! Apply today.
 You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.
 Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?
When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our  IMPACT values – Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork – starts with us.
IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.
We are looking for IMPACT Makers; exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.
Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric – apply today!

+13% organic growth
150 000+ employees in 100+ countries
#1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations

Title: Senior Manager - Unify Data
Description:
Job Description
This role supports the E2E DCR (End to End Digital Customer Relationship) driving the data transformation agenda for UNIFY and E2E DCR
 The End-to-End Digital Customer Data Office supports as many as 5 domain data offices and has the responsibility for their respective data Maturity, following the DCAM playbook. Today’s main gaps for the scalability of our Data Offices within E2E DCR are 1) the appropriate mapping and architecture of our data and 2) the lack of an organized and efficient way to access and consume the data from any of the multiple systems it may reside in.
 Unify is our business transformation program that brings together Schneider Electric’s business, supply chain and finance processes into 1 coherent, standardized and simplified global set of processes. The program includes all the actions related to the re-engineering of our processes through the adoption of SAP S4 HANA public cloud (market standard processes) and hence the adaptation of the required processes to fit this standard, from a data, process, tool, and operating model point of view.
 E2E DCR and UNIFY Collaboration
Partner with multiple streams (Domain/Sub-domain Data Teams, Domain/Business Models Business process owners, Central Governance team, Data Domain owners etc.) involved in the UNIFY program to clarify and drive the master data agenda necessary for business transformation.
 Develop and implement a detailed plan that encompasses all data activities aligned with the goals of the transformation program, with a specific focus on unifying ERP systems within SAP S/4 HANA.
 Act as a data and technology leader in Master data by
 Identifying processes within the "Order to Cash" stream of the transformation program and understanding their global and local business flows.
 Analysing end-to-end data flows between applications and SAP S/4HANA, measuring the impact on UNIFY’s "Order to Cash" processes.
 Proposing optimization techniques for business architecture to enhance scalability, reliability, accuracy, and to reduce costs and complexity.
 Enrichment of the target data model for SAP S/4HANA to ensure alignment with business requirements and adherence to best practices.
 Establishing and overseeing data quality frameworks to guarantee accurate, consistent, and reliable data throughout the organization.
 Leading the planning and validation of data migration activities to SAP S/4HANA, ensuring a smooth transition from legacy systems while minimizing disruptions.
 Implementing robust data governance processes to manage data integrity, compliance, and security.
 Developing a risk management framework to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and internal policies.
 Recommending appropriate technologies to enhance the scalability, reliability, and accuracy of master data. 
 DCR Data Office Responsibilities
Set the strategic vision and plans for the Master Data from DCR Data Office
 Cascade and adapt the data strategy and vision to all relevant teams including, but not limited to data domain offices.
 Clearly communicate strategy, agenda, priorities, ways of working to senior leaders, unit members and relevant stakeholders in the domain data offices
 Re-configure/Hire/Elevate resources to build the virtual delivery pool for DCR (e.g. tapping into the distributed resources)
 Convergence: standardization of data problem solving, data, tech, people practices and adoption of common language and change management
 Cross-leverage: leveraging data assets, tech assets, tools and processes from across business functions and establishing global benchmarks)
 Collaboration: build the right organizational structure and governance to share knowledge and scale
 Initiate data capability building and change management through workshops.
 Set-up or leverage current communities of practice (data governance, master data management) for value cross-pollination.
 Human Resources Responsibilities
 Support UNIFY data resources identification and hiring - Onboard with a minimal ramp up time.
 Support the build and management of the data operations network in domains and geos, leveraging the data business officer network.
 Provide mentorship for the purpose of developing a continuous talent pipeline for key roles in the DCR data offices.
 Identify training needs and coordinate with the HC department to ensure facilitation of training requirements.
Technical Requirements
Over 10 years of experience in SAP S/4HANA implementation, with a strong understanding of “Order to Cash” business processes and data management.
 Expertise in driving the strategy, vision, and mission for data management, including but not limited to Master Data initiatives.
 Proven experience in identifying data requirements for relevant SAP business processes and ensuring that the necessary data is available.
 Hands-on experience in managing SAP data, including data mapping, migration, data quality, and analytics.
 Familiarity with SAP Master Data Governance and its capabilities is a plus.
 Solid understanding of data architectures and modelling techniques, with the ability to drive the master data vision by collaborating with various application teams and business units across different geographies.
 Experience in developing and implementing data quality improvement frameworks.
 Understanding of global data privacy and security guidelines and best practices is a plus.
 Fluent understanding of the technical architecture within a complex application landscape.
 Demonstrated ability to manage a diverse range of projects requiring detailed analysis, creative and practical problem-solving, and effective solution design.
  Professional Competency Requirements
Excellent interpersonal skills, strong verbal and written communication skills, attention to details, and intuitive storytelling ability
 Excellent problem-solving, organizational, and analytical skills with the ability to make high-velocity decisions quickly and based on data, industry trends and stakeholder feedback.
 Confidence, engaging leader, able to communicate a vision and bring people along on the journey.
 Pro-active problem solver with an ability to take initiative and have a strong sense of ownership over shaping and executing upon our analytics transformation initiatives.
 A ‘change agent’ attitude, constantly pushing for new opportunities, more efficient processes, and new perspectives.
  The successful candidate will have an exceptional track record of working within businesses to tackle large-scale business problems, across multiple domains and functions. You must have commercial acumen, ability to understand business problems, exceptional interpersonal skills, and strong background in the data field.
 Furthermore, you will have a demonstrable track record of successfully building and managing scaled, high-quality, data solutions for internal or external organizations with high adoption rates. You must be a self-motivated, team player who can contribute to the overall business objectives of the organization.
 #LI-IR1

Title: Product Manager
Description:
Job Description
About Lauritz Knudsen Electrical and Automation
Lauritz Knudsen Electrical and Automation (A unit of Schneider Electric India Pvt. Ltd.) is a pioneering electrical and automation brand with a rich legacy of over 70 years in India. We offer comprehensive portfolio of low-voltage switchgear, medium-voltage switchgear, automation solutions, software, and services catering to diverse segments, including homes, agriculture, buildings, infrastructure, and industry.
L&T Switchgear is now Lauritz Knudsen Electrical & Automation.
Position Title:   Manager – Product Management and Marketing
Education Qualification: B.Tech / B.E. in Electronics/Telecommunication / Electrical and Electronics / Electrical
Experience: 4 – 8 years
Role & responsibilities
1 Driving Sales of MCCB Products (New Products & Life Cycle Management) with deliverables of ~30 Cr per Month
2 Responsible for Target Margin, Target Sales of Portfolio including New Products, Price Realization, Focus Products.
3 To develop & execute strategic business plans consistent with budget delivering a pipeline of profitable business in short, medium & long term.
4 Support to Sales, Business Development, Customer Support Functions
5 Contribute to the development & launch program for Full Range of MCCBs
6 Work collaboratively with Design, Engineering, Quality, Planning Functions to strengthen product portfolio 
Schedule: Full-time

Title: Manager - Engineering
Description:
Job Description
About Lauritz Knudsen Electrical and Automation
Lauritz Knudsen Electrical and Automation (A unit of Schneider Electric India Pvt. Ltd.) is a pioneering electrical and automation brand with a rich legacy of over 70 years in India. We offer comprehensive portfolio of low-voltage switchgear, medium-voltage switchgear, automation solutions, software, and services catering to diverse segments, including homes, agriculture, buildings, infrastructure, and industry.
L&T Switchgear is now Lauritz Knudsen Electrical & Automation.
Position Title:  Manager – Engineering (EPC Projects)
Education Qualification: B. Tech / B.E. in Electrical and Electronics / Electrical
Experience: 5 - 10 years
Role & responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Lead the design and execution of engineering projects, ensuring adherence to project timelines and budgetary constraints.
Prepare and review engineering documents, including calculations, designs, and vendor documents, to obtain customer and stakeholder approvals.
Engage in discussions with customers, vendors, end users, and consultants to secure necessary approvals and address project requirements.
Participate in equipment/material inspections at vendor facilities to ensure compliance with specifications and quality standards.
Provide on-site support for the erection and commissioning of engineering systems, troubleshooting issues as they arise.
Offer pre-bid engineering support, collaborating with the business development team to provide technical expertise during the bidding process.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering or a related field; master’s degree preferred.
Proven experience in project engineering or related roles.
In-depth knowledge of engineering principles, standards, and best practices.
Strong proficiency in relevant engineering software and tools.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and problem-solving skills.
Skills and Competencies:
Project management skills, including the ability to coordinate multiple tasks and stakeholders.
Technical expertise
Strong attention to detail and a commitment to ensuring quality and compliance.
Excellent interpersonal skills for effective stakeholder engagement and relationship management.
      Schedule: Full-time

Qualifications

1 Overseeing Various Engineering Projects design
2 Preparation of engineering documents like calculation, design, and vendor documents for customer approval.
3 Discussion with Customers and vendors for taking approval on drawings, and documents from end users, and consultants.
4 Participation in the Inspection of equipment/materials at the vendor's place.

6 Prebid engineering Support

Engage in discussions with customers, vendors, end users, and consultants to secure necessary approvals and address project requirements.

Provide on-site support for the erection and commissioning of engineering systems, troubleshooting issues as they arise.
Offer pre-bid engineering support, collaborating with the business development team to provide technical expertise during the bidding process.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering or a related field; master’s degree preferred.
Proven experience in project engineering or related roles.
In-depth knowledge of engineering principles, standards, and best practices.
Strong proficiency in relevant engineering software and tools.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and problem-solving skills.
Skills and Competencies:
Project management skills, including the ability to coordinate multiple tasks and stakeholders.
Technical expertise
Strong attention to detail and a commitment to ensuring quality and compliance.
Excellent interpersonal skills for effective stakeholder engagement and relationship management.
      Schedule: Full-time

Req: 008XJG

Title: Sr Manager/Manager- Sustainability
Description:
Job Description
Description - External
Sr Manager/Manager- Sustainability
  Responsibilities:
1.      Drive and deploy global sustainability actions/programs for the India Zone.
2.      Develop and manage key sustainability performances metrics.
3.      Manage and report sustainability in the day-to-day business operations and value chain.
4.       Work closely with different business entities & functions in the organization to develop sustainability strategies, implement it and monitor.
5.      Create smart quarterly and yearly sustainability targets of the organization and monitor them for reporting to board.
6.      Develop digital dashboards with monthly/quarterly/yearly sustainability report for management review.
7.      Connect with global/regional teams to collaborate and support common programs on sustainability.
8.      Constantly track the company’s impact and operations against the Sustainability Development Goals. 
9.      Reporting as per BRSR compliance and CSRD as per EU directive.
10.    Understanding of sustainability mega and micro trends driving action in India or other countries.
11.   Close analysis of India’s environmental policies and compliances and to align with the day-to-day operations.
12.    Sustainability communication related content creation and external award applications
13.   Create an internal R&R framework and sustainability assessment tool for India business entities.
14.   Create a platform for sustainability case studies/ best practices from all manufacturing units.
15.   Initiate Sustainability campaigns with employee volunteering opportunities.
16.   Constant support to business teams to attain the sustainability targets.
  Qualifications - External
Qualifications:
1.      Deep understanding & conviction of Climate change & circular economy and the challenges posed. Well versed with latest developments & evolving Sustainability landscape.
2.      Ability to comprehend various reports & present the same in an easy-to-understand story telling format
3.      Understanding of the concepts of conservation and sustainable development, including energy conservation, waste management, resource and water conservation, and environmental reporting metrics.
4.      In-depth understanding of the Sustainability Reporting Tools like DJSI, GRI, SROI, GHG protocol etc.
5.      Impeccable writing and communication skills.
6.      Exceptional stakeholder management skills - external + internal leadership
7.      Proficient with Digital platforms- tableau, Power apps, MS Office especially Excel & Powerpoint and other data analysis tools: STATA, SPSS, R etc.
8.      MBA in Sustainability, climate change, environment, or other related areas from premier B school. Preferably a B.Tech at bachelor’s level.
9.       3-8 years of work experience in Sustainability management and implementation in a reputed Corporate or Consultancy.
 
Schedule: Full-time
Req: 00927C

Title: Manager - Commissioning
Description:
Job Description
About Lauritz Knudsen Electrical and Automation
Lauritz Knudsen Electrical and Automation (A unit of Schneider Electric India Pvt. Ltd.) is a pioneering electrical and automation brand with a rich legacy of over 70 years in India. We offer comprehensive portfolio of low-voltage switchgear, medium-voltage switchgear, automation solutions, software, and services catering to diverse segments, including homes, agriculture, buildings, infrastructure, and industry.
L&T Switchgear is now Lauritz Knudsen Electrical & Automation.
Position Title:   Manager – Commissioning
Education Qualification: B. Tech / B.E. in (Electronics/Electrical/Instrumentation)
Experience: 4 – 8 years
Role & responsibilities
  1 Responsible for project delivery and field activities on customer installed base. Dedicated for field activities on customer installed base and project delivery.
2. Leading  team of Automation Commissioning Engineers. Ensuring implementation of all the technical parts of an automation project. Perform technical operational activities in automation.
3 Work closely with customer, engineering team and field team to ensure on time commissioning of system.
4 Visit site for commissioning, review of the job as per customer , Carry out the Site acceptance test.
5 Provide technical support to field automation team for commissioning of System / Process6 Adherence to the processes and ensuring customer satisfaction
Qualifications – Additional
1.     Software Development- Must have worked on SE PLC & SCADA
2. Technical knowledge on electrical / automation
3. Has Process knowledge of Cement, Oil & Gas, Power vertical
Schedule: Full-time

Title: Manager - Sales (Hyderabad)
Description:
Job Description
Responsible for Channel Monitoring in terms of Primary Business-Collection-Material Management etc. /            Business development activities by opening New Channel/ POS /Secondary Sales /Retail activities like Electrician meet/Retailer meet etc.
    Area Head should ensure that his off roll team members understand the team’s objectives and work together to achieve organization GOAL.
    Area Head should be very supportive for team by giving proper guideline about day to day activities / business strategy and assist with any issues the team members may have
  Mainly focus on Wiring Devices (Modular Switches) & Final Distribution (MCBs/DBs/RCCBs) Business which we can expect by 50% Growth
  Based location will be in Madurai and he/she will be responsible to develop business as well as surrounding areas.

Title: Manager/Deputy Manager- Hardware R&D
Description:
Job Description
About Lauritz Knudsen Electrical and Automation
Lauritz Knudsen Electrical and Automation (A unit of Schneider Electric India Pvt. Ltd.) is a pioneering electrical and automation brand with a rich legacy of over 70 years in India. We offer comprehensive portfolio of low-voltage switchgear, medium-voltage switchgear, automation solutions, software, and services catering to diverse segments, including homes, agriculture, buildings, infrastructure, and industry.
L&T Switchgear is now Lauritz Knudsen Electrical & Automation.
Education Qualification: BE (Electronics/ Electronics-communication/industrial/)
Experience: 3-10 years
Key Responsibilities/Deliver:
1.      Design and development of Electronics Hardware, & its testing
2.      Power supply design – SMPS topologies, DC-DC converters, High frequency transformer design.
3.      Analog & Digital circuit design, its signal integrity– Simulation in Pspice, LTSpice, ModelSI IGBT/MOSFET Gate Drivers design, PWM techniques, Snubber design
4.      EMI-EMC Filter Design implementation in electronics circuit design, with compliance of Surge, EFT, ESD, CE,CS RE,RS etc.
5.      Heatsink calculations, Components selections like Capacitors, LDOs, Inductors, X,Y Capacitors
6.      Knowhow of various IEC, CE, UL, standards
7.      PCB layout understanding, review.
8.      Knowledge of various communication protocols like RTU, USB, CAN, TCP, Profibus, etc. from hardware design perspective.
9.      Knowledge of various reliability testing like, HALT, ALT etc.
  Functional Competencies:
1.      Embedded Hardware Design
2.      EMI/EMC standard understanding
3.      Simulation skills
  Desired Overall Skills:
1.      Effective communication
2.      Team player – Individual contributor
3.      Creative and open to learn.

Qualifications

Education Qualification: BE (Electronics/ Electronics-communication/industrial/)
OR
BE (Electronics/ Power Electronics)/ MTech (Power Electronics)

Title: Offer Quality Leader
Description:
Job Description
 Offer Quality Leader for Power Products (Location India-Bangalore)
  Passionate about technical innovations and new business model, open-minded, strong collaboration skills, close to customer, bring voice to innovative projects.
  Rigor, autonomous, collaborative, responsive leadership, English speaker, other language skills welcome are some of your main qualities and competencies.
  If you identify with these qualities?  Offer Quality Leader position in India region for the Power Products Line of Business in the Customer Satisfaction & Quality team is for you!
  We are searching for a  Offer Quality Leader with a strong Quality background, strong knowledge of Hardware/Firmware Motor management /Motor Control with Connected devices/ communication devices …
 firmware quality, software quality best practices, system engineering background
  Job description:
  This position is to bring the customer voice to the future offer and current projects, to ensure technical performance and quality promise.
  The main missions for this position are:
  Mission 1: Project Quality leader
  Bring customer voice to the Offer development project.
Ensure that all customer requirements are considered and integrated from Open to Close project stage gates.
Prepare stage gate reviews while defending customer views and quality performances. Acts as Quality gate keeper.
  Be accountable of technical, quality and business performance.
Ensures new offers from specification to deployment through design and industrialization follow Offer Creation Process (OCP). Adapt its implementation to project specificities and constraints.
Accountable for the Application Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (AFMEA), Design Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (DFMEA), Fault Tree Analysis (FTA).
Support quality methodologies and tools deployment: Quality plan, Design for Quality (DFQ), Risk management.
Insure the full implementation of safety rules and constraints is built into our offers and documentations.
Bring new development concept and good practice sharing.
Stay close to project manager along the project development cycle.
Ensure that voice of customer and quality are in the heart of project team.
Be part of the team cohesion and synergy.
Accountable for lessons learnt from field experience, customers and teams feedback integration.
Assess the project team competency on quality field, if needed insure its training.
Work closely with Offer Quality Leader during deployment phase.
    Mission 2: Offer Quality Leader
The Offer Quality Leader is responsible for defining, maintaining and deploying the quality plan with an objective to drive customer satisfaction.
Lead the cold loop for executing structured problem solving (8D) with engineering and manage customer communication with countries and customers
Assure the application of quality processes (Quality Alerts, Safety Alerts, etc.) and challenge the organization to manage quality risks
Gather and analyze data on product problems, customer cases and product returns from our Customer Care Centre information system
Define and execute Digital Preventive plan, Annual Offer Quality Road Map
Represent the customer to ensure incremental solution evolutions are delivered in a timely manner
Execute customer visits to gather market trends, follow up on field tests and translate the results into actionable requests in the program backlog.
Represent Quality in the Board of Change and Offer Safety committee.
  Profile:
Collaborative and responsive in a large, multicultural and moving environment.
Problem Solver - Experienced in customer facing situation.
Strong team spirit in a large functional environment.
Good verbal and formal communication skills.
Fluent in English and if possible in a second international language.
  Qualifications
Experience in Systems projects with a focus on communication, firmware and software interfaces
Working in a complex organization with dynamic changes
Experience in Agile/Lean system development methodologies and quality management in agile context
Experience in System and Software support for connected for configurable and connected offers
Knowledge of Cybersecurity and the Secure Development Lifecyle is an asset
Fluent in English
Quality process tools and methodology: OCP for PMP and PEP,  Issue to Prevention, 8D, Ishikawa, FTA, ...
Bachelors of Science in Electrical Engineering , Computer science engineering and Mechanical Engineering if possible.
    Environment:
Company :                        Schneider Electric Industries SAS
Business :                          Power Products
Line of Business (LoB) : India
  Anticipate around 2 to 3 business trips abroad or in France per year.
Refers to LoB’s Customer Satisfaction & Quality director.
Full time job localized in India

Qualifications

  Overall 8 years and minimum 4 years of relevant experience is required.

Schedule: Full-time
Req: 008Y4W
